name: This Little Child: Music for Christmas
description:
Benjamin Britten's A Ceremony of Carols gets the holiday season off to a jubilant start! Laurie Evan Fraser conducts the Upper Canada Choristers and their accomplished Latin ensemble, Cantemos, joined by pianist Hye Won (Cecilia) Lee and guest harpist Liane James, with Nora Dunn as narrator. 

The concert features music ranging from a 15th century French carol based on a 12th century Latin text to stirring works of our age, among them British composer Philip Stopford's haunting contemporary setting of the 16th century Coventry Carol, and music by Laurie Evan Fraser, American composer Elaine Hagenberg, and Venezuela's César Alejandro Carrillo. 

The concert also streams live via the choir's website.

organizer.name: Cantemos from the Upper Canada Choristers

name: The Holiday Hop: Social Dance Series
description:
Celebrate the season with rhythm and joy! Every Friday this December, The Holiday Hop series brings you a new social dance every week from swing to salsa and tango. No partner or experience is needed! Learn, move and celebrate the holidays with festive fun, live music and community all month long. 

Swing with Vicky & Benoit and band Viper's Cloud
Tango with Roxana & Fabian and Payadora Ensemble
Salsa with Soul2Sole and Jorge Betancourt

Whether you're looking to learn something new or just want to move to the music, this is the perfect way to get into the holiday spirit. Bring the glam, grab your dancing shoes and join us for festive fun.

name: Tunes & Tales: Tak Arikushi Trio & Sandra Whiting
description:
Embark on a colourful journey every Friday at Old City Hall, where musicians perform from the grand staircase and storytellers fill the council chamber with lively tales that celebrate Toronto's vibrant cultural mosaic. Enjoy soulful tunes, festive melodies and stirring stories with a global flavour that capture the magic of the season. 

This event features inventive arrangements of hot swing jazz music by the Tak Arikushi Trio, plus storytelling by Sandra Whiting, who inspires audiences with her passion and humour.

name: Ariane Morin's Balkan Brass live at DROM Taberna
description: Classic fiery balkan tunes, and maybe some klezmer, featuring some of the finest brass musicians from the Toronto music scene, led by Montrealer folk saxophonist Ariane Morin. With Max Forster on trumpet, Nathan Dell-Vandenberg on trombone and singing, Ian Tulloch on sousaphone and Naghmed Farahmand on percussions.

name: Holiday Season Festive Lights Tour
description:
Discover the magic of Toronto's holiday season! 

Hop on board and enjoy a panoramic view of the city's most iconic landmarks, beautifully illuminated with dazzling Christmas lights.

This guided tour takes you through Toronto's vibrant downtown, showcasing highlights like Nathan Phillips Square, the financial district and Yorkville, all dressed in their festive finest. Marvel at the sparkling displays, twinkling trees, and seasonal decorations that bring the city to life during the holidays.

Enjoy live commentary from an expert guide who shares fascinating stories about Toronto's history, culture, and unique holiday traditions. Perfect for families, couples, and groups, this tour promises an unforgettable evening of festive cheer and stunning sights.

name: Love Hurts live at DROM Taberna
description:
Love Hurts loves country music, and this 6-piece band of veteran Toronto musicians will make you love country music, too. Established in 2022, Love Hurts has been breathing new life into bonafide country classics and forgotten gems, pinning heart wrenching 50s balladry alongside 70s outlaw swagger, and 90s honky-tonk revival with swooning 60s countrypolitan. From Patsy Cline to Linda Ronstadt, George Jones to George Strait, Love Hurts makes the cream of the country music songbook sound as fresh as the day it was made.

Fronted by two dynamic singers, Barbara Johnston and Lowell Sostomi, and back by a cracking band who eat country licks for breakfast, Love Hurts follows no guide but a great song: if the tune makes you weep, call your momma, drink 15 beers, or cuss out your ex, you just might hear it at Love Hurts' next gig.

name: Donovan Locke Trio live at DROM Taberna
description: A genuine staff favourite, Donovan Locke is a jazz vocalist and entertainer who is passionate about performing and inspiring others by ensuring honest and fun performances. Donovan believes that an audience will always respond to an honest performance.

name: Gaysian Comedy All-Stars X-Mas Party with Bren D'Souza!
description:
We are the world's first All-Queer, All-Asian Comedy Showcase!

Celebrate the holiday season with us! 

Featuring our headliner Bren D'Souza, a Toronto-based comedian and writer. Bren has been featured at festivals such as Just For Laughs, NXNE, We're Funny That Way. Bren was nominated for the I Heart Jokes Award for Newcomer Comic of the Year. Bren is also the host and producer of Shredded: The Post Breakup Podcast, which has been featured in the Toronto Star as one of the top 5 comedy podcasts in Toronto.

Joining Bren is a stellar line-up of queer Pan-Asian comedians: Brandon Ash-Mohammed (India), Heather Mariko (Japan), Vong Sho (Laos/Thailand), Nina Phan (Vietnam) and hosted by Rush Kazi (Bangladesh)

These comics have been seen on MTV, CBC, Just For Laughs, Amazon, OUTtv, SiriusXM, Winnipeg Comedy Festival, and more!

name: Festive Night Out: Meet New Friends
description:
Join us for an evening of festive cheer, starting with a winter city walk and hot chocolate and then for games, great company, and delicious food and drinks. 

We'll also be giving away exciting prizes throughout the night.

name: Christine Lavin
description:
Christine Lavin started her professional life in 1975, as a waitress and bread baker at the Caffe Lena in Saratoga Springs, New York. 

This is where she met Dave Van Ronk who encouraged her to study guitar with him in the big city. She took his advice and became a singer songwriter, guitarist, recording artist, author and videographer.

Her latest solo album, On My Way to Hooterville, is her twenty-fifth album and includes 10 new songs and one re-worked song "Ramblin' Waltz". In it, she recalls her time in 1975 when she was an entourage driver for the first week of Bob Dylan's iconic Rolling Thunder Revue tour.

name: DruiZ live at DROM Taberna
description: DruiZ is a musical project by multi-instrumentalist Daniel Ruiz, blending sounds to create unique, improvised sonic journeys. His music emphasizes spontaneity and emotional connection. DruiZ's music knows no bounds. It consists of a unique fusion between electronic and acoustic instrumentals, showcasing his love for spontaneous, meaningful creations. DruiZ's focus on meaningful releases has resulted in a discography impressively defined by its outstanding quality. A true artist and creative at heart, inspiration DruiZ shows us that inspiration can come anywhere from the complex to the exceedingly simple.
